intro: Dolichothele balsasoides, commonly known as the Balsas longtail spider, is a species of orb-weaving spider found primarily in Central America. It is characterized by its slender, elongated body and long legs, which are adaptations for its arboreal lifestyle. The plant-like appearance of its web, often constructed in trees or shrubs, is a key feature of its ecological niche. Its habitat ranges from tropical moist forests to drier regions, where it plays a role in controlling insect populations. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a relatively rare and less studied species within the family Linyphiidae.
